column4: how do i set the env for ruby? /usr/bin/env: ruby: No such file or directory
what's the problem ?
if i try to run a ruby program, i get that output
add /usr/bin/ruby1.9 to your ENVPATH
(and you might want to check in your ruby src file if the path is correctly set to this path)
(and you might want to install ruby XD apt-get install ruby1.9..... not sure about the orthograph
but how do i add it to ENVPATH?
do it manually : /home/you/.bashrc
thanks
you have to close and relaunch your tem after that
didnt know that ENVPATH and PATH was the same thing :)
now i get /usr/bin/env: ruby: Not a directory
what's the first line of your ruby file ?
#!/usr/bin/env ruby
i think it has to be the directory for the ruby, not the executable
didnt help
guess the easiest is to change the first line :)
yep buty you have to do that in every ruby file, quite annoying, there is a command to do that, like env -u or something like that, i'm trying to fin the good one
i guess env ruby=/usr/bin/ruby1.9
should do the trick
but u have to have install ruby 1.9 first
it didnt, but this worked: sudo ln -s /usr/bin/ruby1.9 /usr/bin/ruby
thanks for helping me :)
